result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jesus Hernandez

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jesus Hernandez in court.  Attorney Corey R. Flynn in court for Jesus Hernandez.  Prosecuting attorney Olivia Simmons in court for the State of Wisconsin. Status conference held. Defense is requesting jury trial dates. Case is adjourned in Branch 30.
Final pre-trial scheduled for January 3, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial scheduled for January 30, 2023 at 09:00 am.
CORRECTION: Judge Konkol presided over Branch 13 on August 31st, 2022

Defendant Jesus Hernandez in court.  Attorney Corey R. Flynn in court for Jesus Hernandez.  Prosecuting attorney Nate Kristian McClure in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a pre-trial conference. Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Konkol.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Richards, Br. 30. 
Case adjourned to Br. 30.
Status conference scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in a manner and fashion as prescribed.
No driving without a valid license.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 08/11/2022 IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR, A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Defendant Jesus Hernandez in court.  Mallory R Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Reserve Judge, Branch 13.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 13 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 8/9/22 @ 1p
